backend_frontend_ratio_monitor.name: backend_frontend_ratio_monitor
backend_frontend_ratio_monitor.description: Monitors the ratio of backend events without frontend interactions - alerts if ratio deviates significantly from expected ~8-10%

config.description: Monitors the ratio of backend events without frontend interactions - alerts if ratio deviates significantly from expected ~8-10%

backend_frontend_ratio_monitor.sqlContent:
-- Monitor backendfrontend conversion rate with offer_presented dimension
-- Expected: Events marked offer_presented=true should have frontend matches
-- Events marked offer_presented=false/NULL are legitimate consideration-only events
-- Excludes AI offers which naturally have high consideration rates (~35%)

WITH backend_frontend_stats AS (
  SELECT 
    intent_engine_type,
    
    -- Total events breakdown
    COUNT(*) as total_backend_events,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN offer_presented = true THEN 1 END) as presented_events,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN offer_presented != true OR offer_presented IS NULL THEN 1 END) as consideration_only_events,
    
    -- Frontend match breakdown
    COUNT(CASE WHEN source_type IS NOT NULL THEN 1 END) as events_with_frontend_match,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN offer_presented = true AND source_type IS NOT NULL THEN 1 END) as presented_with_frontend_match,
    COUNT(CASE WHEN offer_presented = true AND source_type IS NULL THEN 1 END) as presented_without_frontend_match,
    
    -- Key ratios
    ROUND(COUNT(CASE WHEN offer_presented = true AND source_type IS NULL THEN 1 END) * 100.0 / 
          NULLIF(COUNT(CASE WHEN offer_presented = true THEN 1 END), 0), 2) as presented_orphaned_pct,
    ROUND(COUNT(CASE WHEN source_type IS NULL THEN 1 END) * 100.0 / COUNT(*), 2) as total_orphaned_pct
    
  FROM `piedotorg-production.intent_engine_dev.offer_expanded_view`
  WHERE DATE(ts) >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 1 DAY)
    AND intent_engine_type NOT IN ('AI', 'MCP')  -- Exclude AI offers
  GROUP BY intent_engine_type
)

-- Alert on data quality issues: presented events without frontend matches
SELECT 
  intent_engine_type,
  total_backend_events,
  presented_events,
  consideration_only_events,
  events_with_frontend_match,
  presented_with_frontend_match,
  presented_without_frontend_match,
  presented_orphaned_pct,
  total_orphaned_pct,
  CASE 
    WHEN presented_orphaned_pct > 5 THEN 
      CONCAT('DATA QUALITY ISSUE: ', CAST(presented_orphaned_pct AS STRING), 
             '% of presented events have no frontend match for ', intent_engine_type, ' (expected ~0%)')
    WHEN intent_engine_type IN ('WEBSITE', 'WEBSITE_ONBOARDING') AND presented_events = 0 THEN
      CONCAT('BACKEND LOGGING ISSUE: 0 events marked as presented for ', intent_engine_type, 
             ' but frontend events exist')
    ELSE NULL
  END as alert_message
FROM backend_frontend_stats
WHERE 
  presented_orphaned_pct > 5  -- Data quality issue: presented but no frontend match
  OR (intent_engine_type IN ('WEBSITE', 'WEBSITE_ONBOARDING') AND presented_events = 0)  -- Backend logging issue

frontend_offers_have_backend_match.name: frontend_offers_have_backend_match
frontend_offers_have_backend_match.description: Ensures all frontend offer events (ext + AI) have corresponding backend matching events

config.description: Ensures all frontend offer events (ext + AI) have corresponding backend matching events

frontend_offers_have_backend_match.sqlContent:
-- Assert that all frontend offer events have backend matches
-- This validates our LEFT JOIN assumption in offer_expanded_view

WITH unified_frontend_offers AS (
  -- Extension offers
  SELECT 
    request_id,
    'ext' as source_type,
    timestamp
  FROM `piedotorg-production.shopping_extension_production.ext_intent_engine_offer`
  WHERE DATE(timestamp) >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 1 DAY)
  
  UNION ALL
  
  -- AI offers  
  SELECT
    request_id,
    'ai' as source_type,
    TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(timestamp_ms) as timestamp
  FROM `piedotorg-production.backend_analytics.ai_intent_engine_offer`
  WHERE DATE(TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(timestamp_ms)) >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 1 DAY)
),

orphaned_frontend_events AS (
  SELECT 
    fe.request_id,
    fe.source_type,
    fe.timestamp as frontend_timestamp,
    be.request_id IS NULL as is_orphaned
  FROM unified_frontend_offers fe
  LEFT JOIN `piedotorg-production.backend_analytics.intent_engine_offer_group_match` be
    ON fe.request_id = be.request_id
  WHERE be.request_id IS NULL  -- Only orphaned events
)

-- Assertion fails if ANY orphaned frontend events exist
SELECT 
  request_id,
  source_type,
  frontend_timestamp,
  CONCAT('Orphaned ', source_type, ' offer event with request_id: ', request_id) as error_message
FROM orphaned_frontend_events

raw_vs_distinct_variance_monitor.name: raw_vs_distinct_variance_monitor
raw_vs_distinct_variance_monitor.description: Monitor variance between raw and distinct counts for shows, clicks, redeems. Expected variance is 1.0-1.15 (up to 15%) for shows/redeems due to duplicate events. Clicks may be higher due to re-clicks. Alerts on variance above 15% or below 95%.

config.description: Monitor variance between raw and distinct counts for shows, clicks, redeems. Expected variance is 1.0-1.15 (up to 15%) for shows/redeems due to duplicate events. Clicks may be higher due to re-clicks. Alerts on variance above 15% or below 95%.

raw_vs_distinct_variance_monitor.sqlContent:
-- Monitor raw vs distinct count variance
-- Expected: Some variance is normal due to:
-- 1. Multiple frontend events per offer (show + view, multiple clicks, etc.)
-- 2. User behavior patterns (re-clicks, multiple interactions)
-- 3. Duplicate events from dual tracking systems
-- Alert threshold set at 1.15 (15% variance) for normal operations

WITH variance_check AS (
  SELECT 
    dt,
    campaign_id,
    merchant_id,
    period,
    
    -- Shows variance - expect ~1.0-1.15 with fixed GROUPING SETS
    CASE 
      WHEN shows > 0 THEN SAFE_DIVIDE(shows_raw, shows)
      ELSE 0
    END as shows_ratio,
    
    -- Clicks variance - may be higher due to re-clicks  
    CASE 
      WHEN clicks > 0 THEN SAFE_DIVIDE(clicks_raw, clicks)
      ELSE 0
    END as clicks_ratio,
    
    -- Redeems variance - should be close to shows ratio
    CASE 
      WHEN redeems > 0 THEN SAFE_DIVIDE(redeems_raw, redeems)
      ELSE 0
    END as redeems_ratio,
    
    shows,
    shows_raw,
    clicks,
    clicks_raw,
    redeems,
    redeems_raw
    
  FROM `piedotorg-production.intent_engine_dev.offer_campaign_ir_base`
  WHERE DATE(dt) >= DATE_SUB(CURRENT_DATE(), INTERVAL 3 DAY)
    AND period = 'day'  -- Daily aggregation only
    AND intent_engine_type IN ('AI', 'MCP')  -- Focus on AI offers where we expect some variance
    AND (shows > 0 OR clicks > 0 OR redeems > 0)  -- Only check rows with actual activity
)

SELECT 
  dt,
  campaign_id, 
  merchant_id,
  shows_ratio,
  clicks_ratio,
  redeems_ratio,
  CONCAT('Shows: ', shows_raw, '/', shows, ' = ', ROUND(shows_ratio, 2), 'x') as shows_detail,
  CONCAT('Clicks: ', clicks_raw, '/', clicks, ' = ', ROUND(clicks_ratio, 2), 'x') as clicks_detail,
  CONCAT('Redeems: ', redeems_raw, '/', redeems, ' = ', ROUND(redeems_ratio, 2), 'x') as redeems_detail
FROM variance_check
WHERE 
  -- Alert on unexpectedly high variance (above 15% for shows/redeems, higher for clicks)
  shows_ratio > 1.15 
  OR clicks_ratio > 2.0  -- Clicks can be higher due to legitimate re-clicks
  OR redeems_ratio > 1.15
  -- Alert on unexpectedly low variance (below 0.95 suggests possible data loss)  
  OR (shows_ratio < 0.95 AND shows > 5)
  OR (clicks_ratio < 0.95 AND clicks > 5)
  OR (redeems_ratio < 0.95 AND redeems > 5)

tag_consistency_check.name: tag_consistency_check
tag_consistency_check.description: Ensures that when both tag_id and ext_tag_id are present in transactions, they are always equal

config.description: Ensures that when both tag_id and ext_tag_id are present in transactions, they are always equal

tag_consistency_check.sqlContent:
-- Check that transactions never have conflicting tag values
-- When both tag_id and ext_tag_id exist, they must be equal
SELECT 
  transactionId,
  ext_tag_id,
  tag_id,

FROM `piedotorg-production.data_science_dev.transactions_expanded_view`

tenant_field_consistency_check.name: tenant_field_consistency_check
tenant_field_consistency_check.description: Ensures tenant fields (tenant_id, tenant_client_id) are consistently present or absent across backend and AI offers for the same request_id

config.description: Ensures tenant fields (tenant_id, tenant_client_id) are consistently present or absent across backend and AI offers for the same request_id

tenant_field_consistency_check.sqlContent:
-- Check for requests where tenant fields are inconsistent between backend and AI offers
-- Only checks requests that have BOTH backend and AI frontend events
-- It's OK if both have NULL tenant data or both have tenant data, but not mixed
WITH request_summary AS (
  SELECT 
    request_id,
    -- Check if this request has backend rows
    MAX(CASE WHEN source_type IS NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS has_backend_rows,
    -- Check if this request has AI frontend events
    MAX(CASE WHEN source_type = 'ai' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS has_ai_rows,
    -- Check if backend rows have tenant data
    MAX(CASE WHEN source_type IS NULL AND (tenant_id IS NOT NULL OR tenant_client_id IS NOT NULL) THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS backend_has_tenant,
    -- Check if AI rows have tenant data
    MAX(CASE WHEN source_type = 'ai' AND (tenant_id IS NOT NULL OR tenant_client_id IS NOT NULL) THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS ai_has_tenant
  FROM `piedotorg-production.intent_engine_dev.offer_expanded_view`
  WHERE DATE(ts) >= CURRENT_DATE() - 7 -- Check last 7 days
  GROUP BY request_id
),
inconsistent_requests AS (
  SELECT 
    request_id,
    backend_has_tenant,
    ai_has_tenant,
    CASE 
      WHEN backend_has_tenant = 1 AND ai_has_tenant = 0 THEN 'Backend has tenant, AI missing'
      WHEN backend_has_tenant = 0 AND ai_has_tenant = 1 THEN 'AI has tenant, Backend missing'
    END AS inconsistency_type
  FROM request_summary
  WHERE 
    -- Only check requests that have BOTH backend AND AI rows
    has_backend_rows = 1 AND has_ai_rows = 1
    -- Flag inconsistency: one has tenant data but the other doesn't
    AND (
      (backend_has_tenant = 1 AND ai_has_tenant = 0) 
      OR (backend_has_tenant = 0 AND ai_has_tenant = 1)
    )
)
SELECT 
  request_id,
  inconsistency_type,
  backend_has_tenant,
  ai_has_tenant
FROM inconsistent_requests
LIMIT 1 -- Assertion fails if any inconsistent records exist

model.name: fact_ai_intent_engine
model.description: Fact table for AI intent engine frontend events, enriched with campaign/offer data from mapping

config.description: Fact table for AI intent engine frontend events, enriched with campaign/offer data from mapping

model.sqlContent:
-- Fact table for AI Intent Engine frontend events only
SELECT
  -- Timestamps
  TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(ae.timestamp_ms) AS event_ts,
  m.backend_ts,
  UNIX_MILLIS(m.backend_ts) AS timestamp_ms,
  
  -- Action mapping for funnel
  CASE
    WHEN ae.action IN ('show', 'view') THEN 'impression'
    WHEN ae.action = 'click' THEN 'click'
    WHEN ae.action = 'close' THEN 'dismissal'
    ELSE COALESCE(ae.action, 'unknown')
  END AS action,
  
  ae.action AS original_action,
  
  -- Core identifiers
  ae.request_id,
  ae.offer_id,
  
  -- From mapping
  m.campaign_id,
  m.merchant_id,
  m.device_id,
  
  -- User identifiers
  COALESCE(m.user_id, ae.user_id) AS user_id,
  ae.id AS anonymous_id,
  
  -- Source info
  m.intent_engine_type,
  'ai' AS source_type,
  
  -- Tenant fields
  ae.tenant_id,
  ae.tenant_client_id,
  ae.tenant_rewards_enabled,
  
  -- AI-specific fields
  ae.outbound_url,
  ae.surface,
  ae.is_rewards,
  ae.user_agent,
  ae.tag_id,
  
  -- From mapping
  m.req_offer,
  m.top_offer,
  m.offer_award,
  m.offer_content,
  m.offer_cta,
  m.campaign_boost,
  m.campaign_active,
  m.campaign_state,
  m.campaign_budget,
  m.offergroup_id,
  m.offergroup_min_bid,
  m.offergroup_max_bid,
  m.offergroup_bid_type

FROM `piedotorg-production.backend_analytics.ai_intent_engine_offer` ae
LEFT JOIN `piedotorg-production.fact_tables_dev.request_offer_campaign_mapping` m
  ON ae.request_id = m.request_id
  AND ae.offer_id = m.offer_id
  -- Match on tenant_client_id for AI offers
  AND ae.tenant_client_id = m.tenant_client_id

model.name: fact_offer_attribution_models
model.description: Multi-model attribution table with 5 attribution models. Only includes transactions that successfully match at least one attribution model. Creates rows for ALL matching attribution models per transaction.

config.description: Multi-model attribution table with 5 attribution models. Only includes transactions that successfully match at least one attribution model. Creates rows for ALL matching attribution models per transaction.

model.sqlContent:
-- Multi-model attribution fact table
-- Creates one row per transaction per attribution model
WITH 
-- Base transaction data (AFFILIATE only)
transaction_base AS (
  SELECT
    DATETIME(created_coalesce_ts) AS transaction_ts,
    transactionId AS transaction_id,
    anonymous_id,
    userId AS user_id,
    CASE WHEN merchantId = 'logitechg' THEN 'logitech' ELSE merchantId END AS merchant_id,
    CASE 
      WHEN merchantId = 'verizon' AND IFNULL(externalSaleValue, 0) = 0 
      THEN externalCommission 
      ELSE externalSaleValue 
    END AS external_sale_value_cents,
    externalCommission AS external_commission_cents,
    millipoints,
    type AS transaction_type,
    ext_tag_id,
    campaignId AS direct_campaign_id -- For direct AD_OFFER transactions
  FROM `piedotorg-production.data_science_dev.transactions_expanded_view`
  WHERE type = 'AFFILIATE'  -- Only AFFILIATE transactions for attribution
    AND created_coalesce_ts IS NOT NULL
    AND merchantId IS NOT NULL
),

-- Get all click events from enriched int_fe_offer table
click_events AS (
  SELECT
    event_ts,
    campaign_id,
    merchant_id,
    offer_id,
    request_id,
    user_id,
    anonymous_id,
    device_id,
    source_type,
    intent_engine_type,
    req_offer,
    tenant_id,
    offer_award,
    offer_content,
    COALESCE(ext_tag_id, tag_id) AS ext_tag_id,  -- Use ext_tag_id for Extension, tag_id for AI
    first_placement_template,
    first_placement_id,
    first_placement_match,
    first_placement_hostname,
    placement_count
  FROM `piedotorg-production.fact_tables_dev.int_fe_offer`
  WHERE action = 'click'
    AND campaign_id IS NOT NULL
    AND merchant_id IS NOT NULL
),

-- Get all impression events from enriched int_fe_offer table
impression_events AS (
  SELECT
    event_ts,
    campaign_id,
    merchant_id,
    offer_id,
    request_id,
    user_id,
    anonymous_id,
    device_id,
    source_type,
    intent_engine_type,
    req_offer,
    tenant_id,
    offer_award,
    offer_content,
    COALESCE(ext_tag_id, tag_id) AS ext_tag_id,  -- Use ext_tag_id for Extension, tag_id for AI
    first_placement_template,
    first_placement_id,
    first_placement_match,
    first_placement_hostname,
    placement_count
  FROM `piedotorg-production.fact_tables_dev.int_fe_offer`
  WHERE action = 'impression'
    AND campaign_id IS NOT NULL
    AND merchant_id IS NOT NULL
),

-- 1. Tag ID Attribution (Deterministic)
tag_id_attribution AS (
  SELECT
    tb.transaction_ts,
    tb.transaction_id,
    'tag_id' AS attribution_model,
    TRUE AS attributed,
    'deterministic' AS attribution_confidence,
    
    -- Transaction details
    tb.merchant_id,
    ce.campaign_id,
    ce.offer_id,
    ce.request_id,
    ce.req_offer,
    
    -- User identifiers
    COALESCE(tb.user_id, ce.user_id) AS user_id,
    COALESCE(tb.anonymous_id, ce.anonymous_id) AS anonymous_id,
    ce.device_id,
    
    -- Transaction metrics
    tb.transaction_type,
    tb.external_sale_value_cents / 100 AS external_sale_value_dollars,
    tb.external_commission_cents / 100 AS external_commission_dollars,
    tb.millipoints,
    
    -- Attribution event details
    ce.event_ts AS attribution_event_ts,
    'click' AS attribution_event_action,
    ce.source_type AS attribution_event_source,
    NULL AS attribution_window_hours, -- Deterministic, no window
    DATETIME_DIFF(tb.transaction_ts, DATETIME(ce.event_ts), HOUR) AS time_to_conversion_hours,
    
    -- Tag-specific fields
    tb.ext_tag_id,
    
    -- Campaign metadata
    ce.intent_engine_type,
    ce.source_type,
    ce.tenant_id,
    ce.offer_award,
    ce.offer_content,
    
    -- Placement fields
    ce.first_placement_template,
    ce.first_placement_id,
    ce.first_placement_match,
    ce.first_placement_hostname,
    ce.placement_count
    
  FROM transaction_base tb
  INNER JOIN click_events ce
    ON tb.ext_tag_id = ce.ext_tag_id
    AND tb.merchant_id = ce.merchant_id
    AND (
      -- Primary: match on user_id if both have it
      (tb.user_id IS NOT NULL AND ce.user_id = tb.user_id)
      -- Fallback: match on anonymous_id if user_id is NULL
      OR (tb.user_id IS NULL AND tb.anonymous_id IS NOT NULL AND ce.anonymous_id = tb.anonymous_id)
    )
    AND DATETIME(ce.event_ts) <= tb.transaction_ts  -- Click must be before transaction
  WHERE tb.ext_tag_id IS NOT NULL
    AND ce.ext_tag_id IS NOT NULL
),

-- 2. Click 24h Last-Touch Attribution
click_24h_attribution AS (
  SELECT 
    transaction_ts,
    transaction_id,
    attribution_model,
    attributed,
    attribution_confidence,
    merchant_id,
    campaign_id,
    offer_id,
    request_id,
    req_offer,
    user_id,
    anonymous_id,
    device_id,
    transaction_type,
    external_sale_value_dollars,
    external_commission_dollars,
    millipoints,
    attribution_event_ts,
    attribution_event_action,
    attribution_event_source,
    attribution_window_hours,
    time_to_conversion_hours,
    ext_tag_id,
    intent_engine_type,
    source_type,
    tenant_id,
    offer_award,
    offer_content,
    first_placement_template,
    first_placement_id,
    first_placement_match,
    first_placement_hostname,
    placement_count
  FROM (
    SELECT
      tb.transaction_ts,
      tb.transaction_id,
      'click_24h' AS attribution_model,
      TRUE AS attributed,
      'last_touch' AS attribution_confidence,
      
      -- Transaction details
      tb.merchant_id,
      ce.campaign_id,
      ce.offer_id,
      ce.request_id,
      ce.req_offer,
      
      -- User identifiers
      COALESCE(tb.user_id, ce.user_id) AS user_id,
      COALESCE(tb.anonymous_id, ce.anonymous_id) AS anonymous_id,
      ce.device_id,
      
      -- Transaction metrics
      tb.transaction_type,
      tb.external_sale_value_cents / 100 AS external_sale_value_dollars,
      tb.external_commission_cents / 100 AS external_commission_dollars,
      tb.millipoints,
      
      -- Attribution event details
      ce.event_ts AS attribution_event_ts,
      'click' AS attribution_event_action,
      ce.source_type AS attribution_event_source,
      24 AS attribution_window_hours,
      DATETIME_DIFF(tb.transaction_ts, DATETIME(ce.event_ts), HOUR) AS time_to_conversion_hours,
      
      -- Tag-specific fields
      tb.ext_tag_id,
      
      -- Campaign metadata
      ce.intent_engine_type,
      ce.source_type,
      ce.tenant_id,
      ce.offer_award,
      ce.offer_content,
      
      -- Placement fields
      ce.first_placement_template,
      ce.first_placement_id,
      ce.first_placement_match,
      ce.first_placement_hostname,
      ce.placement_count,
      
      -- Rank for last-touch logic
      ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
        PARTITION BY tb.transaction_id 
        ORDER BY DATETIME(ce.event_ts) DESC
      ) AS click_rank
      
    FROM transaction_base tb
    INNER JOIN click_events ce
      ON tb.merchant_id = ce.merchant_id
      AND (
        -- Primary: match on user_id if both have it
        (tb.user_id IS NOT NULL AND ce.user_id = tb.user_id)
        -- Fallback: match on anonymous_id if user_id is NULL
        OR (tb.user_id IS NULL AND tb.anonymous_id IS NOT NULL AND ce.anonymous_id = tb.anonymous_id)
      )
      AND DATETIME(ce.event_ts) <= tb.transaction_ts
      AND DATETIME_DIFF(tb.transaction_ts, DATETIME(ce.event_ts), HOUR) <= 24
  )
  WHERE click_rank = 1  -- Last touch only
),

-- 3. Click 7d Last-Touch Attribution  
click_7d_attribution AS (
  SELECT 
    transaction_ts,
    transaction_id,
    attribution_model,
    attributed,
    attribution_confidence,
    merchant_id,
    campaign_id,
    offer_id,
    request_id,
    req_offer,
    user_id,
    anonymous_id,
    device_id,
    transaction_type,
    external_sale_value_dollars,
    external_commission_dollars,
    millipoints,
    attribution_event_ts,
    attribution_event_action,
    attribution_event_source,
    attribution_window_hours,
    time_to_conversion_hours,
    ext_tag_id,
    intent_engine_type,
    source_type,
    tenant_id,
    offer_award,
    offer_content,
    first_placement_template,
    first_placement_id,
    first_placement_match,
    first_placement_hostname,
    placement_count
  FROM (
    SELECT
      tb.transaction_ts,
      tb.transaction_id,
      'click_7d' AS attribution_model,
      TRUE AS attributed,
      'last_touch' AS attribution_confidence,
      
      -- Transaction details
      tb.merchant_id,
      ce.campaign_id,
      ce.offer_id,
      ce.request_id,
      ce.req_offer,
      
      -- User identifiers
      COALESCE(tb.user_id, ce.user_id) AS user_id,
      COALESCE(tb.anonymous_id, ce.anonymous_id) AS anonymous_id,
      ce.device_id,
      
      -- Transaction metrics
      tb.transaction_type,
      tb.external_sale_value_cents / 100 AS external_sale_value_dollars,
      tb.external_commission_cents / 100 AS external_commission_dollars,
      tb.millipoints,
      
      -- Attribution event details
      ce.event_ts AS attribution_event_ts,
      'click' AS attribution_event_action,
      ce.source_type AS attribution_event_source,
      168 AS attribution_window_hours, -- 7 days * 24 hours
      DATETIME_DIFF(tb.transaction_ts, DATETIME(ce.event_ts), HOUR) AS time_to_conversion_hours,
      
      -- Tag-specific fields
      tb.ext_tag_id,
      
      -- Campaign metadata
      ce.intent_engine_type,
      ce.source_type,
      ce.tenant_id,
      ce.offer_award,
      ce.offer_content,
      
      -- Placement fields
      ce.first_placement_template,
      ce.first_placement_id,
      ce.first_placement_match,
      ce.first_placement_hostname,
      ce.placement_count,
      
      -- Rank for last-touch logic
      ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
        PARTITION BY tb.transaction_id 
        ORDER BY DATETIME(ce.event_ts) DESC
      ) AS click_rank
      
    FROM transaction_base tb
    INNER JOIN click_events ce
      ON tb.merchant_id = ce.merchant_id
      AND (
        -- Primary: match on user_id if both have it
        (tb.user_id IS NOT NULL AND ce.user_id = tb.user_id)
        -- Fallback: match on anonymous_id if user_id is NULL
        OR (tb.user_id IS NULL AND tb.anonymous_id IS NOT NULL AND ce.anonymous_id = tb.anonymous_id)
      )
      AND DATETIME(ce.event_ts) <= tb.transaction_ts
      AND DATETIME_DIFF(tb.transaction_ts, DATETIME(ce.event_ts), HOUR) <= 168 -- 7 days
  )
  WHERE click_rank = 1  -- Last touch only
),

-- 4. View 24h Last-Touch Attribution (independent of click attribution)
view_24h_attribution AS (
  SELECT 
    transaction_ts,
    transaction_id,
    attribution_model,
    attributed,
    attribution_confidence,
    merchant_id,
    campaign_id,
    offer_id,
    request_id,
    req_offer,
    user_id,
    anonymous_id,
    device_id,
    transaction_type,
    external_sale_value_dollars,
    external_commission_dollars,
    millipoints,
    attribution_event_ts,
    attribution_event_action,
    attribution_event_source,
    attribution_window_hours,
    time_to_conversion_hours,
    ext_tag_id,
    intent_engine_type,
    source_type,
    tenant_id,
    offer_award,
    offer_content,
    first_placement_template,
    first_placement_id,
    first_placement_match,
    first_placement_hostname,
    placement_count
  FROM (
    SELECT
      tb.transaction_ts,
      tb.transaction_id,
      'view_24h' AS attribution_model,
      TRUE AS attributed,
      'view_assist' AS attribution_confidence,
      
      -- Transaction details
      tb.merchant_id,
      ie.campaign_id,
      ie.offer_id,
      ie.request_id,
      ie.req_offer,
      
      -- User identifiers
      COALESCE(tb.user_id, ie.user_id) AS user_id,
      COALESCE(tb.anonymous_id, ie.anonymous_id) AS anonymous_id,
      ie.device_id,
      
      -- Transaction metrics
      tb.transaction_type,
      tb.external_sale_value_cents / 100 AS external_sale_value_dollars,
      tb.external_commission_cents / 100 AS external_commission_dollars,
      tb.millipoints,
      
      -- Attribution event details
      ie.event_ts AS attribution_event_ts,
      'impression' AS attribution_event_action,
      ie.source_type AS attribution_event_source,
      24 AS attribution_window_hours,
      DATETIME_DIFF(tb.transaction_ts, DATETIME(ie.event_ts), HOUR) AS time_to_conversion_hours,
      
      -- Tag-specific fields
      tb.ext_tag_id,
      
      -- Campaign metadata
      ie.intent_engine_type,
      ie.source_type,
      ie.tenant_id,
      ie.offer_award,
      ie.offer_content,
      
      -- Placement fields
      ie.first_placement_template,
      ie.first_placement_id,
      ie.first_placement_match,
      ie.first_placement_hostname,
      ie.placement_count,
      
      -- Rank for last-touch logic
      ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
        PARTITION BY tb.transaction_id 
        ORDER BY DATETIME(ie.event_ts) DESC
      ) AS impression_rank
      
    FROM transaction_base tb
    INNER JOIN impression_events ie
      ON tb.merchant_id = ie.merchant_id
      AND (
        -- Primary: match on user_id if both have it
        (tb.user_id IS NOT NULL AND ie.user_id = tb.user_id)
        -- Fallback: match on anonymous_id if user_id is NULL
        OR (tb.user_id IS NULL AND tb.anonymous_id IS NOT NULL AND ie.anonymous_id = tb.anonymous_id)
      )
      AND DATETIME(ie.event_ts) <= tb.transaction_ts
      AND DATETIME_DIFF(tb.transaction_ts, DATETIME(ie.event_ts), HOUR) <= 24
  )
  WHERE impression_rank = 1  -- Last touch only
),

-- 5. View 7d Last-Touch Attribution (independent of click attribution)
view_7d_attribution AS (
  SELECT 
    transaction_ts,
    transaction_id,
    attribution_model,
    attributed,
    attribution_confidence,
    merchant_id,
    campaign_id,
    offer_id,
    request_id,
    req_offer,
    user_id,
    anonymous_id,
    device_id,
    transaction_type,
    external_sale_value_dollars,
    external_commission_dollars,
    millipoints,
    attribution_event_ts,
    attribution_event_action,
    attribution_event_source,
    attribution_window_hours,
    time_to_conversion_hours,
    ext_tag_id,
    intent_engine_type,
    source_type,
    tenant_id,
    offer_award,
    offer_content,
    first_placement_template,
    first_placement_id,
    first_placement_match,
    first_placement_hostname,
    placement_count
  FROM (
    SELECT
      tb.transaction_ts,
      tb.transaction_id,
      'view_7d' AS attribution_model,
      TRUE AS attributed,
      'view_assist' AS attribution_confidence,
      
      -- Transaction details
      tb.merchant_id,
      ie.campaign_id,
      ie.offer_id,
      ie.request_id,
      ie.req_offer,
      
      -- User identifiers
      COALESCE(tb.user_id, ie.user_id) AS user_id,
      COALESCE(tb.anonymous_id, ie.anonymous_id) AS anonymous_id,
      ie.device_id,
      
      -- Transaction metrics
      tb.transaction_type,
      tb.external_sale_value_cents / 100 AS external_sale_value_dollars,
      tb.external_commission_cents / 100 AS external_commission_dollars,
      tb.millipoints,
      
      -- Attribution event details
      ie.event_ts AS attribution_event_ts,
      'impression' AS attribution_event_action,
      ie.source_type AS attribution_event_source,
      168 AS attribution_window_hours, -- 7 days * 24 hours
      DATETIME_DIFF(tb.transaction_ts, DATETIME(ie.event_ts), HOUR) AS time_to_conversion_hours,
      
      -- Tag-specific fields
      tb.ext_tag_id,
      
      -- Campaign metadata
      ie.intent_engine_type,
      ie.source_type,
      ie.tenant_id,
      ie.offer_award,
      ie.offer_content,
      
      -- Placement fields
      ie.first_placement_template,
      ie.first_placement_id,
      ie.first_placement_match,
      ie.first_placement_hostname,
      ie.placement_count,
      
      -- Rank for last-touch logic
      ROW_NUMBER() OVER (
        PARTITION BY tb.transaction_id 
        ORDER BY DATETIME(ie.event_ts) DESC
      ) AS impression_rank
      
    FROM transaction_base tb
    INNER JOIN impression_events ie
      ON tb.merchant_id = ie.merchant_id
      AND (
        -- Primary: match on user_id if both have it
        (tb.user_id IS NOT NULL AND ie.user_id = tb.user_id)
        -- Fallback: match on anonymous_id if user_id is NULL
        OR (tb.user_id IS NULL AND tb.anonymous_id IS NOT NULL AND ie.anonymous_id = tb.anonymous_id)
      )
      AND DATETIME(ie.event_ts) <= tb.transaction_ts
      AND DATETIME_DIFF(tb.transaction_ts, DATETIME(ie.event_ts), HOUR) <= 168 -- 7 days
  )
  WHERE impression_rank = 1  -- Last touch only
)

-- Union all attribution models (only attributed transactions)
SELECT * FROM tag_id_attribution
UNION ALL
SELECT * FROM click_24h_attribution
UNION ALL

UNION ALL

UNION ALL

model.name: fact_web_intent_engine_offer
model.description: Fact table for web intent engine frontend events, enriched with campaign/offer data from mapping

config.description: Fact table for web intent engine frontend events, enriched with campaign/offer data from mapping

model.sqlContent:
-- Fact table for Web Intent Engine frontend events only
SELECT
  -- Timestamps
  we.timestamp AS event_ts,
  m.backend_ts,
  UNIX_MILLIS(m.backend_ts) AS timestamp_ms,
  
  -- Action mapping for funnel
  CASE
    WHEN we.action IN ('show', 'view') THEN 'impression'
    WHEN we.action = 'click' THEN 'click'
    WHEN we.action = 'close' THEN 'dismissal'
    ELSE COALESCE(we.action, 'unknown')
  END AS action,
  
  we.action AS original_action,
  
  -- Core identifiers
  we.request_id,
  we.offer_id,
  
  -- From mapping
  m.campaign_id,
  m.merchant_id,
  m.device_id,
  
  -- User identifiers
  COALESCE(m.user_id, we.user_id) AS user_id,
  we.anonymous_id,
  
  -- Source info
  m.intent_engine_type,
  'web' AS source_type,
  
  -- Web-specific fields
  we.surface,
  we.is_rewards,
  we.context_locale,
  we.context_device_type,
  
  -- From mapping
  m.req_offer,
  m.top_offer,
  m.offer_award,
  m.offer_content,
  m.offer_cta,
  m.campaign_boost,
  m.campaign_active,
  m.campaign_state,
  m.campaign_budget,
  m.offergroup_id,
  m.offergroup_min_bid,
  m.offergroup_max_bid,
  m.offergroup_bid_type,
  
  -- Tenant fields from mapping (web doesn't have its own tenant fields)
  m.tenant_id,
  m.tenant_client_id

FROM `piedotorg-production.website_production.web_intent_engine_offer` we
LEFT JOIN `piedotorg-production.fact_tables_dev.request_offer_campaign_mapping` m
  ON we.request_id = m.request_id
  AND we.offer_id = m.offer_id

model.name: int_fe_offer
model.description: Intermediate table that unions all frontend offer events (AI, Extension, Web) with backend mapping data. Single source of truth for enriched frontend events with campaign/offer metadata.

config.description: Intermediate table that unions all frontend offer events (AI, Extension, Web) with backend mapping data. Single source of truth for enriched frontend events with campaign/offer metadata.

model.sqlContent:
-- Unified frontend offer events with backend mapping enrichment
-- Combines all frontend sources (AI, Extension, Web) with request_offer_campaign_mapping
WITH unified_frontend AS (
  -- AI events
  SELECT
    request_id,
    offer_id,
    TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(timestamp_ms) AS event_ts,
    CASE
      WHEN action IN ('show', 'view') THEN 'impression'
      WHEN action = 'click' THEN 'click'
      WHEN action = 'close' THEN 'dismissal'
      ELSE COALESCE(action, 'unknown')
    END AS action,
    action AS original_action,
    user_id,
    id AS anonymous_id,
    'ai' AS source_type,
    surface,
    is_rewards,
    outbound_url,
    user_agent,
    tag_id,
    NULL AS ext_tag_id,
    tenant_id,
    tenant_client_id,
    tenant_rewards_enabled,
    NULL AS platform,
    NULL AS referer_url,
    NULL AS context_locale,
    NULL AS context_device_type,
    NULL AS context_app_name,
    NULL AS context_app_version,
    NULL AS context_browser,
    NULL AS context_browser_version,
    NULL AS context_device_id,
    NULL AS context_id,
    NULL AS context_ip,
    NULL AS context_library_name,
    NULL AS context_library_version,
    NULL AS context_os_os,
    NULL AS context_os_version,
    NULL AS context_os_name,
    NULL AS context_time_zone,
    NULL AS event,
    NULL AS event_text,
    NULL AS loaded_at,
    NULL AS original_timestamp,
    NULL AS received_at,
    NULL AS sent_at,
    NULL AS uuid_ts
  FROM `piedotorg-production.backend_analytics.ai_intent_engine_offer`
  
  UNION ALL
  
  -- Extension events
  SELECT
    request_id,
    offer_id,
    timestamp AS event_ts,
    CASE
      WHEN action IN ('show', 'view') THEN 'impression'
      WHEN action = 'click' THEN 'click'
      WHEN action = 'close' THEN 'dismissal'
      ELSE COALESCE(action, 'unknown')
    END AS action,
    action AS original_action,
    user_id,
    anonymous_id,
    'ext' AS source_type,
    surface,
    is_rewards,
    NULL AS outbound_url,
    context_user_agent AS user_agent,
    NULL AS tag_id,
    ext_tag_id,
    NULL AS tenant_id,
    NULL AS tenant_client_id,
    NULL AS tenant_rewards_enabled,
    platform,
    referer_url,
    context_locale,
    context_device_type,
    context_app_name,
    context_app_version,
    context_browser,
    context_browser_version,
    context_device_id,
    context_id,
    context_ip,
    context_library_name,
    context_library_version,
    context_os_os,
    context_os_version,
    context_os_name,
    context_time_zone,
    event,
    event_text,
    loaded_at,
    original_timestamp,
    received_at,
    sent_at,
    uuid_ts
  FROM `piedotorg-production.shopping_extension_production.ext_intent_engine_offer`
  
  UNION ALL
  
  -- Web events
  SELECT
    request_id,
    offer_id,
    timestamp AS event_ts,
    CASE
      WHEN action IN ('show', 'view') THEN 'impression'
      WHEN action = 'click' THEN 'click'
      WHEN action = 'close' THEN 'dismissal'
      ELSE COALESCE(action, 'unknown')
    END AS action,
    action AS original_action,
    user_id,
    anonymous_id,
    'web' AS source_type,
    surface,
    is_rewards,
    NULL AS outbound_url,
    context_user_agent AS user_agent,
    NULL AS tag_id,
    NULL AS ext_tag_id,
    NULL AS tenant_id,
    NULL AS tenant_client_id,
    NULL AS tenant_rewards_enabled,
    NULL AS platform,
    NULL AS referer_url,
    context_locale,
    context_device_type,
    NULL AS context_app_name,
    NULL AS context_app_version,
    NULL AS context_browser,
    NULL AS context_browser_version,
    NULL AS context_device_id,
    NULL AS context_id,
    NULL AS context_ip,
    NULL AS context_library_name,
    NULL AS context_library_version,
    NULL AS context_os_os,
    NULL AS context_os_version,
    NULL AS context_os_name,
    context_timezone AS context_time_zone,
    event,
    event_text,
    loaded_at,
    original_timestamp,
    received_at,
    sent_at,
    uuid_ts
  FROM `piedotorg-production.website_production.web_intent_engine_offer`
)

-- Join frontend events with backend mapping data
SELECT
  -- Core identifiers
  fe.request_id,
  fe.offer_id,
  
  -- Timestamps
  fe.event_ts,
  m.backend_ts,
  UNIX_MILLIS(m.backend_ts) AS timestamp_ms,
  
  -- Actions
  fe.action,
  fe.original_action,
  
  -- User identifiers
  COALESCE(m.user_id, fe.user_id) AS user_id,
  fe.anonymous_id,
  m.device_id,
  
  -- Source identification
  fe.source_type,
  m.intent_engine_type,
  fe.surface,
  fe.is_rewards,
  
  -- Campaign/Offer metadata from mapping
  m.campaign_id,
  m.merchant_id,
  m.req_offer,
  m.top_offer,
  m.offer_award,
  m.offer_content,
  m.offer_cta,
  m.campaign_boost,
  m.campaign_active,
  m.campaign_state,
  m.campaign_budget,
  m.offergroup_id,
  m.offergroup_min_bid,
  m.offergroup_max_bid,
  m.offergroup_bid_type,
  
  -- Placement fields from mapping
  m.first_placement_template,
  m.first_placement_id,
  m.first_placement_match,
  m.first_placement_hostname,
  m.placement_count,
  
  -- Search context from mapping
  m.keywords,
  
  -- Source-specific fields from frontend
  fe.outbound_url,
  fe.user_agent,
  fe.tag_id,
  fe.ext_tag_id,
  COALESCE(fe.tenant_id, m.tenant_id) AS tenant_id,
  COALESCE(fe.tenant_client_id, m.tenant_client_id) AS tenant_client_id,
  fe.tenant_rewards_enabled,
  fe.platform,
  fe.referer_url,
  fe.context_locale,
  fe.context_device_type,
  
  -- Context fields from frontend
  fe.context_app_name,
  fe.context_app_version,
  fe.context_browser,
  fe.context_browser_version,
  fe.context_device_id,
  fe.context_id,
  fe.context_ip,
  fe.context_library_name,
  fe.context_library_version,
  fe.context_os_os,
  fe.context_os_version,
  fe.context_os_name,
  fe.context_time_zone,
  fe.event,
  fe.event_text,
  fe.loaded_at,
  fe.original_timestamp,
  fe.received_at,
  fe.sent_at,
  fe.uuid_ts

FROM unified_frontend fe
LEFT JOIN `piedotorg-production.fact_tables_dev.request_offer_campaign_mapping` m
  ON fe.request_id = m.request_id
  AND fe.offer_id = m.offer_id
  -- Special matching for AI offers using tenant_client_id (handle NULL values)
  AND (fe.source_type != 'ai' OR COALESCE(fe.tenant_client_id, '') = COALESCE(m.tenant_client_id, ''))

model.name: request_offer_campaign_mapping
model.description: Mapping table that joins backend offer data with campaign and tenant information. Provides a clean reference for request-offer-campaign relationships without event duplication.

config.description: Mapping table that joins backend offer data with campaign and tenant information. Provides a clean reference for request-offer-campaign relationships without event duplication.

model.sqlContent:
-- Request-Offer-Campaign mapping table
-- This provides a clean reference without event duplication
WITH backend_offers AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT
    -- Request level
    request_id,
    TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(timestamp_ms) AS backend_ts,
    device_id,
    user_id,
    placement_hashes,
    
    -- Offer level  
    offer_id,
    offer_content,
    offer_click_url,
    offer_cta,
    offer_award,
    offer_distribution,
    top_offer,
    
    -- Campaign level (from backend)
    campaign_id,
    campaign_boost,
    
    -- Merchant level
    merchant_id,
    
    -- Offer group level
    offergroup_id,
    offergroup_min_bid,
    offergroup_max_bid,
    offergroup_bid_type,
    
    -- Tenant level
    tenant_id,
    tenant_client_id,
    
    -- Source info
    intent_engine_type,
    client,
    
    -- Search context
    keywords,
    
    -- Composite key
    CONCAT(request_id, '|', offer_id) AS req_offer
    
  FROM `piedotorg-production.backend_analytics.intent_engine_offer_group_match`
  WHERE request_id IS NOT NULL
    AND offer_id IS NOT NULL
),

-- Get placement data
placement_data AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT
    placementHash,
    template,
    placementId,
    match,
    hostname,
    offerGroupId
  FROM `piedotorg-production.analytics_etl.campaigns_placements`
),

-- Get campaign metadata
campaign_data AS (
  SELECT 
    campaignId,
    merchantId,
    budget,
    TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(created) AS campaign_created_ts,
    COALESCE(TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(updated), TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(created)) AS campaign_updated_ts,
    CASE 
      WHEN endDate IS NOT NULL THEN TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(endDate)
      WHEN state IN ('PAUSED', 'ENDED', 'CANCELLED', 'ARCHIVED') THEN COALESCE(TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(updated), TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(created))
      ELSE NULL 
    END AS campaign_ended_ts,
    CASE WHEN state = 'ACTIVE' THEN true ELSE false END AS campaign_active,
    state AS campaign_state,
    CASE WHEN startDate IS NOT NULL THEN TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(startDate) ELSE TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(created) END AS campaign_start_ts
  FROM `piedotorg-production.analytics_etl.campaigns_campaigns`
)

SELECT
  -- Request level
  bo.request_id,
  bo.backend_ts,
  bo.device_id,
  bo.user_id,
  bo.placement_hashes,
  
  -- Offer level
  bo.offer_id,
  bo.offer_content,
  bo.offer_click_url,
  bo.offer_cta,
  bo.offer_award,
  bo.offer_distribution,
  bo.top_offer,
  
  -- Campaign level (merged)
  bo.campaign_id,
  bo.campaign_boost,
  cd.campaign_active,
  cd.campaign_state,
  cd.budget AS campaign_budget,
  cd.campaign_created_ts,
  cd.campaign_updated_ts,
  cd.campaign_ended_ts,
  cd.campaign_start_ts,
  
  -- Merchant level
  bo.merchant_id,
  
  -- Offer group level
  bo.offergroup_id,
  bo.offergroup_min_bid,
  bo.offergroup_max_bid,
  bo.offergroup_bid_type,
  
  -- Tenant level
  bo.tenant_id,
  bo.tenant_client_id,
  
  -- Source info
  bo.intent_engine_type,
  bo.client,
  
  -- Composite key
  bo.req_offer,
  
  -- Placement fields (from first matching placement)
  pd.template AS first_placement_template,
  pd.placementId AS first_placement_id,
  pd.match AS first_placement_match,
  pd.hostname AS first_placement_hostname,
  ARRAY_LENGTH(bo.placement_hashes) AS placement_count,
  
  -- Search context
  bo.keywords

FROM backend_offers bo
LEFT JOIN campaign_data cd
  ON bo.campaign_id = cd.campaignId
  AND bo.merchant_id = cd.merchantId
  -- Only join campaigns that were active during the offer
  AND DATE(bo.backend_ts) >= DATE(cd.campaign_start_ts)
--  AND (cd.campaign_ended_ts IS NULL OR DATE(bo.backend_ts) <= DATE(cd.campaign_ended_ts))
LEFT JOIN placement_data pd
  ON pd.placementHash = bo.placement_hashes[SAFE_OFFSET(0)]  -- Join on first placement hash
  AND pd.offerGroupId = bo.offergroup_id

model.name: all_campaigns
model.description: Consolidated campaign data from all marketing channels including paid campaigns, influencer spend, and manual CPM data

config.description: Consolidated campaign data from all marketing channels including paid campaigns, influencer spend, and manual CPM data

model.sqlContent:
WITH
  
  influencer_data AS (
    SELECT
      influencer_name,
      vanity_url,
      puci,
      cost,
      SAFE_CAST(start_date AS DATE) start_date,
      amortize_days
    FROM `piedotorg-production.growth_marketing.dpr_manual_spend`
  ),
  
  publisher_cpms AS (
    SELECT 
      NET.REG_DOMAIN(website) AS domain,
      concept,
      puci,
      cpm,
      SAFE_CAST(start_date AS DATE) start_date,
      SAFE_CAST(end_date AS DATE) end_date
    FROM `piedotorg-production.growth_marketing.dpr_manual_publisher_cpms`
    where puci is not null
  ),
  
  expanded_data AS (
    SELECT
      influencer_name,
      vanity_url,
      puci,
      cost,
      amortize_days,
      DATE_ADD(start_date, INTERVAL day_offset DAY) AS date,
      cost / amortize_days AS daily_cost
    FROM
      influencer_data,
      UNNEST(GENERATE_ARRAY(0, amortize_days - 1)) AS day_offset
  ),
  
  influencer_daily AS (
    SELECT
      date,
      'infl' AS source,
      influencer_name AS campaign_name,
      puci,
      CAST(NULL AS STRING) AS ad_set_name,
      NULL AS impressions,
      NULL AS clicks,
      daily_cost AS cost,
      NULL AS conversions_app_installs,
      NULL AS conversions_ext_installs
    FROM expanded_data
  ),
  
  apple_campaigns AS (
    SELECT
      date,
      'apple' AS source,
      campaign_name,
      puci,
      CAST(NULL AS STRING) AS ad_set_name,
      impressions,
      clicks,
      cost,
      conversions_app_installs,
      NULL AS conversions_ext_installs
    FROM `piedotorg-production.growth_marketing.apple_search_campaign_funnel`
  ),
  
  google_campaigns AS (
    SELECT
      date,
      'google' AS source,
      campaign_name,
      -- temp hack to get pmax
      IF(SPLIT(campaign_name, '_')[SAFE_OFFSET(3)] IN ("pmax", "pmax-desktop", "pmax-mobile"), 
         campaign_name, puci) AS puci,
      CAST(NULL AS STRING) AS ad_set_name,
      impressions,
      clicks,
      cost,
      NULL AS conversions_app_installs,
      conversions_ext_installs
    FROM `piedotorg-production.growth_marketing.google_campaign_funnel`
  ),
  
  msft_campaigns AS (
    SELECT
      date,
      'microsoft' AS source,
      campaign_name,
      ad_group_name AS puci,
      ad_group_name AS ad_set_name,
      impressions,
      clicks,
      cost,
      NULL AS conversions_app_installs,
      conversions AS conversions_ext_installs
    FROM `piedotorg-production.growth_marketing.msft_campaign_funnel`
  ),
  
  amazon_campaigns AS (
    SELECT
      date,
      'amazon_dsp' AS source,
      campaign_name,
      ad_name AS puci,
      ad_group_name AS ad_set_name,
      impressions,
      clicks,
      cost,
      NULL AS conversions_app_installs,
      conversions AS conversions_ext_installs
    FROM `piedotorg-production.growth_marketing.amazon_dsp_campaign_funnel`
  ),
  
  meta_campaigns AS (
    SELECT
      date,
      'meta' AS source,
      campaign_name,
      puci,
      ad_set_name,
      impressions,
      clicks,
      costs AS cost,
      NULL AS conversions_app_installs,
      NULL AS conversions_ext_installs
    FROM `piedotorg-production.growth_marketing.meta_campaign_funnel`
  ),
  
  tik_tok_campaigns AS (
    SELECT
      date,
      'tiktok' AS source,
      campaign_name,
      puci,
      ad_group_name AS ad_set_name,
      impressions,
      clicks,
      cost,
      conversions_app_installs,
      NULL AS conversions_ext_installs
    FROM `piedotorg-production.growth_marketing.tiktok_ads_campaign_funnel`
  ),
  
  bizdev AS (
    SELECT
      date,
      'bizdev_manual' AS source,
      CAST(NULL AS STRING) AS campaign_name,
      puci,
      CAST(NULL AS STRING) AS ad_set_name,
      NULL AS impressions,
      NULL AS clicks,
      SUM(payout_total) AS cost,
      NULL AS conversions_app_installs,
      NULL AS conversions_ext_installs
    FROM `piedotorg-production.growth_marketing_dev.bizdev_spend`
    WHERE cpi > 0  -- Only include countries with actual CPI rates for cost calculations
    GROUP BY date, puci
  ),
  
  impression_cost AS (
    -- Step 1: count events per pixel and cap at 2
    WITH pixel_daily AS (
      SELECT
        DATE(TIMESTAMP_MILLIS(timestamp), 'America/Los_Angeles') AS date,
        NET.REG_DOMAIN(url) AS domain,
        pixel_id,
        COUNT(*) AS ev_count
      FROM `piedotorg-production.backend_analytics.pixel`
      WHERE source = 'wall_view'
      GROUP BY date, domain, pixel_id
    )
    -- Step 2: sum the capped impressions per day/domain
    SELECT
      a.date,
      'manual_cpms' AS source,
      CAST(NULL AS STRING) AS campaign_name,
      publisher_cpms.puci,
      CAST(NULL AS STRING) AS ad_set_name,
      a.pxid_impressions AS impressions,
      NULL AS clicks,
      a.pxid_impressions *
        IF((a.date BETWEEN publisher_cpms.start_date AND publisher_cpms.end_date)
           OR (a.date >= publisher_cpms.start_date AND publisher_cpms.end_date IS NULL),
           publisher_cpms.cpm, 0) / 1000 AS cost,
      NULL AS conversions_app_installs,
      NULL AS conversions_ext_installs
    FROM (
      SELECT
        date,
        domain,
        SUM(LEAST(ev_count, 2)) AS pxid_impressions
      FROM pixel_daily
      GROUP BY date, domain
    ) AS a
    LEFT JOIN publisher_cpms ON a.domain = publisher_cpms.domain
    WHERE publisher_cpms.puci IS NOT NULL
  ),
  
  -- Combine all campaign sources
  all_campaigns_union AS (
    SELECT * FROM apple_campaigns
    UNION ALL
    SELECT * FROM google_campaigns
    UNION ALL
    SELECT * FROM amazon_campaigns
    UNION ALL
    SELECT * FROM meta_campaigns
    UNION ALL
    SELECT * FROM tik_tok_campaigns
    UNION ALL
    SELECT * FROM influencer_daily
    UNION ALL
    SELECT * FROM bizdev
    UNION ALL
    SELECT * FROM msft_campaigns 
    UNION ALL
    SELECT * FROM impression_cost
  ),
  
  -- Add PUCI parsing and aggregation to prevent duplicates
  final AS (
    SELECT
      date,
      source,
      campaign_name,
      puci,
      ad_set_name,
      SUM(impressions) AS impressions,
      SUM(clicks) AS clicks,
      SUM(cost) AS cost,
      SUM(conversions_app_installs) AS conversions_app_installs,
      SUM(conversions_ext_installs) AS conversions_ext_installs,
      SPLIT(puci, '_')[SAFE_OFFSET(2)] AS puci_geo,
      SPLIT(puci, '_')[SAFE_OFFSET(3)] AS placement,
      `piedotorg-production.data_science.TopN`(puci, '_', 16) AS puci_16,
      `piedotorg-production.data_science.TopN`(puci, '_', 8) AS puci_8
    FROM all_campaigns_union
    GROUP BY date, source, campaign_name, puci, ad_set_name, puci_geo, placement, puci_16, puci_8
  )

SELECT
  final.*,
  mapping.platform,
  mapping.media_source,
  mapping.spend_type,
  mapping.funnel,
  mapping.device_target
FROM final
LEFT JOIN `piedotorg-production.growth_marketing.dpr_manual_mapping` mapping
  USING (placement)

model.name: bizdev_spend
model.description: Business development spend calculations based on CPI rates and extension install data

config.description: Business development spend calculations based on CPI rates and extension install data

model.sqlContent:
WITH
  cpi_manual AS (
    SELECT
      geo,
      placement,
      puci,
      cpi, 
      CAST(start_date AS DATE) start_date,
      ifnull(CAST(end_date AS DATE), current_date("America/Los_Angeles")) end_date
    FROM
      `piedotorg-production.growth_marketing.dpr_manual_external`
  ),
  
  adblock_installs AS (
    SELECT
      DATE(timestamp, 'America/Los_Angeles') AS date,
      context_locale,
      anonymous_id AS ext_anonymous_id,
      extension_type,
      context_country,
      puci, -- this accounts for pre 1.1.1 pucis in the installs_base logic
      placement,
      product,
      CASE
        WHEN context_country IS NOT NULL THEN context_country
        WHEN context_locale IN ('en-US', 'es-US') THEN 'US'
        WHEN context_locale IN ('en-AU') THEN 'AU'
        WHEN context_locale IN ('en-CA', 'fr-CA') THEN 'CA'
        WHEN context_locale IN ('en-GB', 'en-GB-oxendict', 'en') THEN 'GB'
        WHEN context_locale IN ('en-DE', 'de', 'de-DE') THEN 'DE'
        ELSE "OTHER_LOCALE" -- this is for pre 2/25 context_country being added
      END AS country_coalesce
    FROM `piedotorg-production.growth_marketing.installs_base_w_reinstall`
    WHERE
      extension_type IN ('adblock', 'adblocker') 
      AND IFNULL(NOT is_synced_install, is_first_install)
      AND puci IS NOT NULL
      AND placement IS NOT NULL
      AND product IS NOT NULL
  ),
  
  base AS (
    SELECT
      date,
      adblock_installs.placement,
      product,
      adblock_installs.puci,
      country_coalesce,
      MAX(IF(date BETWEEN start_date AND end_date, cpi, 0)) as cpi, -- get the actual CPI rate
      FORMAT_DATE('%Y-%m', date) AS year_month,
      COUNT(DISTINCT ext_anonymous_id) AS extension_install_count
    FROM
      adblock_installs
    LEFT JOIN
      cpi_manual
    ON
      cpi_manual.geo = adblock_installs.country_coalesce
      AND adblock_installs.placement = cpi_manual.placement
      AND ((cpi_manual.puci IS NOT NULL AND adblock_installs.puci = cpi_manual.puci)
           OR (cpi_manual.puci IS NULL))
    GROUP BY date, placement, product, puci, country_coalesce, year_month
  )

SELECT
  date,
  country_coalesce,
  placement,
  puci,
  product,
  extension_install_count,
  cpi,
  cpi AS payout_amount,
  cpi * extension_install_count AS payout_total,
  year_month
FROM base
